primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God binds all of humanity (Jews and Gentiles) into a state of disobedience not to destroy them, but to create a vacuum that only His mercy can fill, ultimately resulting in the salvation of all.

tekstueel_bewijs: God has bound all men over to disobedience
He will banish ungodliness from Jacob
God in his mercy has chosen to save you

object.identificatie: Mercy / Salvation / The banishing of ungodliness
tekstueel_bewijs: that he may have mercy on them all
God is infinitely, unimaginably bigger and stronger than our 'badness'
mercy as a result of God’s mercy to you
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is positioned strictly as a Receiver of unmerited favor.

tekstueel_bewijs: by God’s help so I will
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject; Christ is the Mediator/Helper.

tekstueel_bewijs: the illusion of being free from fault
the omnipotent self has become God
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described as a power that 'binds' humanity, requiring a divine jailbreak rather than just a moral adjustment.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human attempt to achieve righteousness or manage 'badness' through self-effort or blaming others.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The 'Omnipotent Self' / The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The preacher identifies this secondary program as a 'delusion' that is interrupted and collapsed by the primary program of God's mercy.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God did not abandon Adam and Eve
He will turn badness into goodness
God has consigned all men to disobedience
voorbeelden_mens_subject: we try to transfer the blame
we cling to our own righteousness

voorbeelden: You must be a good girl
the rules that God has given
God... wants us to be obedient
we are meant humbly to think
God is infinitely... stronger than our badness
we live according to his power

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on God's 'ability' (Pouvoir) to overcome human 'inability.' It moves from the human 'Must' (which fails) to the Divine 'Can' (which triumphs).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: The sermon moves from S2 (Disobedience) through ~S1 (the failure of works) to S1 (Mercy as the final word).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: God uses S2 as the very instrument to deliver S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; disobedience is a 'binding' state, not a minor slip.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It explicitly rejects the 'God helps those who help themselves' motif and places the agency of salvation entirely on God's sovereign initiative.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: what you want is a child who obeys

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as the Subject of Salvation
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He will turn badness into goodness... We will not do it; he will do it in us
it is no longer on the basis of works: otherwise grace would no longer be grace

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures like Adam or the Israelites are used as examples of failure/disobedience, not as moral models to emulate.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Adam is the 'Anti-Hero' whose failure sets the stage for God's mercy.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from the burden of self-justification; shift from self-focus to God-focus.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon maintains a tight hierarchy where the 'Secondary Program' (human effort) is shown to be a subset of God's larger 'Primary Program' of mercy.
spanning_punten: The tension between God's command to obey and His 'binding' of people to disobedience.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit writes the law on the heart, providing the 'Pouvoir' that the human Subject lacked.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is a 'binding' and a 'hardening' that humans cannot break.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is powered by God's mercy. The human subject is correctly identified as 'incompetent' (lacking Pouvoir), and God is the 'Enabling Subject.'

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain current balance; it serves the grace-orientation well.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Opponent (Sin/Self) is already presented as an inescapable cosmic trap.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This is a masterclass in theocentric preaching. It successfully dismantles the 'omnipotent self' and replaces it with the 'omnipotent God' without falling into antinomianism.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric might focus on the 'parent/child' metaphors, semiotics reveals that these metaphors actually serve to highlight the Subject's total dependence.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Romans 11; semiotics shows how the sermon's structure forces the hearer to occupy the role of 'helpless receiver.'
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas's model exposes that even when the preacher mentions 'Ten Commandments,' they function not as a mandate for the Subject to fulfill, but as a diagnostic tool to prove the Subject's need for a Sender's mercy.

appendices.notities: The sermon explicitly critiques C.S. Lewis for making the human 'choice' the ultimate subject, which is a classic semiotic move to protect the 'God-as-Subject' structure.
